unnormalised: **Automotive News: Fuel Efficiency Takes Center Stage**
normalised: Automotive News: Fuel Efficiency Takes Center Stage

unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26 - As fuel prices continue to pinch pockets across India, automotive manufacturers and consumers alike are focusing on fuel efficiency. Dr. Meena Sharma, a professor at IIT Delhi, emphasizes that optimizing engine design and vehicle weight is crucial for improved mileage.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six - As fuel prices continue to pinch pockets across India, automotive manufacturers and consumers alike are focusing on fuel efficiency. Doctor Meena Sharma, a professor at I I T Delhi, emphasizes that optimizing engine design and vehicle weight is crucial for improved mileage.

unnormalised: "Even small adjustments can make a significant difference," she notes, citing ongoing research into lighter materials and hybrid technologies. The rising popularity of CNG and electric vehicles also reflects this trend.
normalised: "Even small adjustments can make a significant difference," she notes, citing ongoing research into lighter materials and hybrid technologies. The rising popularity of C N G and electric vehicles also reflects this trend.

unnormalised: Consumers are increasingly scrutinizing km/l (kilometers per liter) figures before making purchase decisions. Features like start-stop technology and aerodynamic designs are becoming standard.
normalised: Consumers are increasingly scrutinizing kilometer per liter figures before making purchase decisions. Features like start-stop technology and aerodynamic designs are becoming standard.

unnormalised: In related news, ARAI (Automotive Research Association of India) is reportedly set to introduce more stringent fuel efficiency standards by 2025. Maruti Suzuki announced plans to expand its CNG vehicle offerings, targeting middle-class families in cities like Jaipur and Lucknow. Analysts estimate fuel savings of up to Rs. 10,000 annually for commuters switching to more fuel-efficient cars covering approximately 15,000 km. This shift could also incentivize investment in smaller, more efficient engines displacing larger engine types, ultimately reducing the environmental footprint of the automotive sector, whose infrastructure footprint can involve spaces of 10,000 sq ft or more.
normalised: In related news, A R A I (Automotive Research Association of India) is reportedly set to introduce more stringent fuel efficiency standards by two thousand and twenty five. Maruti Suzuki announced plans to expand its C N G vehicle offerings, targeting middle-class families in cities like Jaipur and Lucknow. Analysts estimate fuel savings of up to rupee ten thousand annually for commuters switching to more fuel-efficient cars covering approximately fifteen thousand kilometer. This shift could also incentivize investment in smaller, more efficient engines displacing larger engine types, ultimately reducing the environmental footprint of the automotive sector, whose infrastructure footprint can involve spaces of ten thousand square feet or more.
